sense.def: ① Alternative Names zong chi 縱弛 ; chi huan 弛緩 ; zong huan 縱緩 ; huan ruo 緩弱 ; ju huan 拘 緩. Illness Sign of a slackening and weakening of limbs and joints so that even though one may still be able to raise the four extremities one depends on physical assistance, such as a cane, to move. Zhu bing yuan hou lun 諸病源候論 2: 四肢頑痹，支節火燃，心裏懊熱，手足俱 緩 , “The four limbs are affected by stubborn blockage. The joints feel as if on fire. The heart feels regret and heat. Hands and feet slacken” ...

② Pulse Quality Abbreviated Designation of huan mai 緩脈 , relaxed movement in the vessels. Su wen 素問 18: 緩而滑 曰熱中 , “If [the movement in the vessels] is relaxed and smooth, this is called: ‘heated center’”. ③ Therapeutic Approach Abbreviated Designation of huan ji 緩急 , to relax tensions, and huan zhong 緩中 , to relax the center. Su wen 素問 22: 肝苦急，急食甘以緩之 , “When the liver suffers from tensions, quickly consume sweet [flavor] to relax [these tensions]”.
